ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Absolutely essential for anyone interested in making organic molecules above a low threshold of complexity. For everyone else, a great exercise in logical thinking and creativity.
Learn how to think about disconnecting molecules. Yes, I would recommend this to other grad students, the way the professor teaches also could help any undergrads who took the course
I definitely will recommend this course to be continued next year, especially useful for the synthetic chemists.

Professor Phillips was a great speaker and made the class very interesting. I felt he could have made the class faster-paced though. I would certainly recommend it to a student who was not already very familiar with the field of organic synthesis.
Would recommend--provides a broad overview of recent natural product synthesis. Learned about several useful reactions.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I've always loved total synthesis even though I am not working one of those projects; I enjoyed and benefited from seeing how a real total synthesis chemist thinks about molecules; I am sure I will find a reaction one day which professor went over in class and use hisadvice.
Help me understand better pulse sequences used to generate the NMR readings
I learned to think about how to approach the synthesis of complex natural products from a different perspective.
Definitely deepened my knowledge; learned about many syntheses I had not seen before.
